snippet: The clashing perspectives of witnesses was echoed in the partisan sparring of lawmakers at a House hearing on the deadly attack last month in Benghazi, Libya.
abstract: Eric A Nordstrom, former chief security officer for American Embassy in Libya, testifies before House committee investigating fatal attack on Benghazi diplomatic compound that killed Ambassador Chris Stevens; says his request to extend deployment of an American military team was thwarted by State Department's Bureau of Diplomatic Security.
lead_paragraph: The clashing perspectives of witnesses was echoed in the partisan sparring of lawmakers at a House hearing on the deadly attack last month in Benghazi, Libya.

headline.seo: Hearing Focuses on Attack that Killed Ambassador
headline.main: Official Tells Panel a Request for Libya Was Denied
headline.print_headline: Official Says Security Request for Libya Was Denied

keywords.value: House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform
keywords.name: organizations
